cellularAutomata.util.music
Class MusicalInstrument

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.util.music.MusicalInstrument

public class MusicalInstrument
extends java.lang.Object

Plays musical notes that correspond to the notes on a piano. A piano has keys numbered from 1 (lowest "A") to 88 ("highest "C"). By selecting a number from 1 to 88, the play method will reproduce the corresponding piano's note. Values larger than 88 and less than 1 will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

Silent notes or "rests" can be played by specifying any key with a volume of 0 and a nonzero duration.

The duration of each note can be specified in milliseconds. The volume is a number between 0 and 127 with 0 being inaudible and 127 being the loudest. Default values for duration and volume are 150 milliseconds and 60 unless reset after the class is instantiated.

A synthesizer or midi is used to reproduce the notes. The synthesizer must be opened prior to use (openSynthesizer) and closed after use (closeSynthesizer).

An example of use: 

 MusicalInstrument piano = new MusicalInstrument();
 
 try
 {
     piano.openSynthesizer();
 
     //play chromatic scale
     for(int i = 0; i <= 88; i++)
     {
         piano.play(i);
     }
 }
 catch(javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException e)
 {
     System.out.println("Could not open midi. " + e.toString());
 }
 finally
 {
     //a finally clause is always executed at the end of a
     //try-catch clause, even if a failure made the code 
     //enter the catch clause.  So this is a very safe way 
     //to close the synthesizer.  Will always happen!
     piano.closeSynthesizer();
 }
This code was authored by David Bahr and is only intended for use with Regis University computer science classes.

Version:
1.3 11/1/05
Author:
David Bahr

Method Detail

allNotesOff

public void allNotesOff()
Turns off all notes currently being played.

Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

closeSynthesizer

public void closeSynthesizer()
Closes the synthesizer properly so that it does not interfere with other applications. If the synthesizer is not open, then this method will not close the synthesizer.

getLoadedInstruments

public javax.sound.midi.Instrument[] getLoadedInstruments()
An array of instruments loaded into the synthesizer;

Returns:
An array of instruments.

public int getDefaultDuration()
The default duration in milliseconds. 150 milliseconds unless reset with setDefaultDuration.

Returns:
default duration of note

getDefaultVolume

public int getDefaultVolume()
The default volume as a number between 0 (inaudible) and 127 (loudest). Default is 60 unless reset with setDefaultVolume.

Returns:
default volume of note

public boolean isNoteOn(int keyNumber)
Checks if the given piano key is already playing.

Parameters:
keyNumber - The piano key (note) that will be checked to see if it is currently playing.
Returns:
true if the specified note is playing

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Tests for presence of the sythensizer.

Returns:
true if synthesizer is open

noteOff

public void noteOff(int keyNumber)
             throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Turns off the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87). A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C".

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

noteOn

public void noteOn(int keyNumber)
            throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Plays the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87) with the given volume. The note's duration is infinite and will continue sounding until it is turned off (see method noteOff()). A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C".

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

noteOn

public void noteOn(int keyNumber,
                   int volume)
            throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Plays the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87) with the given volume. The note's duration is infinite and will continue sounding until it is turned off (see method noteOff()). A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C".

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
volume - Number between 0 and 127.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

openSynthesizer

public void openSynthesizer()
                     throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Request the default synthesizer (used to play music).

Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer is unavailable

play

public void play(int keyNumber)
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Plays the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87). A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C". The default duration and volume are used.

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

play

public void play(int keyNumber,
                 int duration)
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Plays the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87) with the given duration. A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C". The default volume is used.

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
duration - In milliseconds.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

play

public void play(int keyNumber,
                 int duration,
                 int volume)
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Plays the note corresponding to the key number on the piano (0 to 87) with the given duration and volume. A piano has 88 keys and this method starts counting from 0. Therefore a 0 is the lowest "A" on the piano and a 39 is "middle C".

Parameters:
keyNumber - A piano key's number between 0 and 87.
volume - Number between 0 and 127.
duration - In milliseconds.
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if Midi Synthesizer has not been opened.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not between 0 and 127.
